title: Rewrite the rust-installer submodule in Rust

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
The [rust-installer repository](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-installer) has long served the purpose of generating manifests and installers for all of our standard artifacts. Over time though it's unfortunately really showing its age as it's become more and more difficult to maintain over time. With rustbuild nowadays let's take this opportunity to rewrite it into Rust!

This transition would most likely look like:

* Add a new tool, `src/tools/installer`
* Add appropriate crates.io dependencies to `src/tools/installer/Cargo.toml`
* Reimplement the installer in Rust, including various commands and scripts.
* Replace all calls in [`dist.rs`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/036983201d4e9aeb5c5e56e47c305971972b2569/src/bootstrap/dist.rs) to `rust-installer/*.sh` to calls into this new project. For an example of invoking a tool written in Rust, you can see how we [call `cargotest`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/036983201d4e9aeb5c5e56e47c305971972b2569/src/bootstrap/check.rs#L88-L93)

This'd be a great opportunity for anyone looking to get their feet wet with Rust's distribution infrastructure and build system! It's also a relatively meaty project to boot :)
